oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Excerpt 3 from oral history interview with James Stephen Turner, 2006 June 21
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville business and civic leader James Stephen (Steve) Turner, conducted on 21 June 2006 by Andrea Blackman as part of the Nashville Public Library's Nashville Business Leaders Oral History Project: The Turner Interviews. Turner discusses an incident during the early 1960s when a Dollar General warehouse was struck by lightening and flooded and how the local community in Scottsville, Kentucky, pitched in to help them recover the merchandise. The complete interview, as well as an index, is available in the repository.
